member.name: T:Sudoku.UI.App
member.summary: Provides application-specific behavior to supplement the default class.

member.name: F:Sudoku.UI.App._window
member.summary: Indicates the main window in this application in the current interaction logic.

summary.para: This is the first line of authored code executed, and as such is the logical equivalent of main() or WinMain().

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.App.OnLaunched(Microsoft.UI.Xaml.LaunchActivatedEventArgs)

summary.para: Invoked when the application is launched normally by the end user.
Other entry points will be used such as when the application is launched to open a specific file.

member.param: Details about the launch request and process.

member.name: T:Sudoku.UI.Data.Converters.SudokuDigitConverter
member.summary: Defines a converter that allows the conversions between sudoku digit (between 0 and 9, and 0 is for the empty cell) and a value.

member.name: T:Sudoku.UI.Drawing.PointConversions
member.summary: Stores a set of methods on handling point conversions.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Drawing.PointConversions.GridSize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the grid size from the specified pane size and the outside offset.
member.param: The outside offset value. The value must be a positive value.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Drawing.PointConversions.BlockSize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the block size from the specified pane size and the outside offset.
member.param: The outside offset value. The value must be a positive value.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Drawing.PointConversions.CellSize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the cell size from the specified pane size and the outside offset.
member.param: The outside offset value. The value must be a positive value.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Drawing.PointConversions.CandidateSize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the candidate size from the specified pane size and the outside offset.
member.param: The outside offset value. The value must be a positive value.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Drawing.PointConversions.GetBlockLine(System.Double,System.Double,System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the start and end point that corresponds to the target block line at the specified index.
member.param: The index of the target block line. The value must be between 0 and 3.
member.returns: The two points indicating the start and end point of the line.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Drawing.PointConversions.GetCellLine(System.Double,System.Double,System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the start and end point that corresponds to the target cell line at the specified index.
member.param: The index of the target cell line. The value must be between 0 and 9.
member.returns: The two points indicating the start and end point of the line.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Drawing.PointConversions.GetCandidateLine(System.Double,System.Double,System.Byte)
member.summary: Gets the start and end point that corresponds to the target candidate line at the specified index.
member.param: The index of the target candidate line. The value must be between 0 and 27.
member.returns: The two points indicating the start and end point of the line.

member.name: M:Sudoku.UI.Drawing.PointConversions.GetLine(System.Double,System.Double,System.Byte,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the start and end point that corresponds to the target line at the specified index, with the specified line weight.
member.param: The index of the target line.
The weight of the line type. The value must be 3, 9 or 27.
member.returns: The two points indicating the start and end point of the line.

member.summary: Initializes a instance via the specified details.
member.param: The stroke color of the block line.
The stroke width of the block line.
The order. The value can only be between 0 and 19. For more details of the parameter, please see the property .

member.name: P:Sudoku.UI.Drawing.Shapes.BlockLine.Order
member.summary:
The order of the block line. The value must be between 0 and 19.
Range Description
>= 0 and < 4 The block line is horizontal.
>= 4 and < 8 The block line is vertical.
